channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Transgressing the algebraic coarse character map
item.description: arXiv:2507.10816v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We pursue an old conjecture of John Roe about the algebraic K-theory of the algebra of finite propagation, locally trace-class operators, namely that transgressing the algebraic coarse character map on this algebra to a Higson dominated corona coincides with the usual Chern character on the corona.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Engel, Matthias Ludewig

item.title: Survey on the Farrell-Jones Conjecture
item.description: arXiv:2507.11337v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This is a survey on the Farrell-Jones Conjecture about the algebraic K- and L-theory of groups rings and its applications to algebra, geometry, group theory, and topology.
item.dc:creator: Wolfgang Lueck

item.title: On t-structures adjacent and orthogonal to weight structures
item.description: arXiv:2403.07855v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We study $t$-structures (on triangulated categories) that are closely related to weight structures. A $t$-structure couple $t=(C_{t\le 0},C_{t\ge 0})$ is said to be adjacent to a weight structure $w=(C_{w\le 0}, C_{w\ge 0})$ if $C_{t\ge 0}=C_{w\ge 0}$. For a category $C$ that satisfies the Brown representability property we prove that $t$ that is adjacent to $w$ exists if and only if $w$ is smashing (that is, "respects C-coproducts"). The heart $Ht$ of this $t$ is the category of those functors $Hw^{op}\to Ab$ that respect products (here $Hw$ is the heart of $w$); the result has important applications. We prove several more statements on constructing $t$-structures starting from weight structures; we look for a strictly orthogonal $t$-structure $t$ on some $C'$ (where $C,C'$ are triangulated subcategories of a common $D$) such that $C'_{t\le 0}$ (resp. $C'_{t\ge 0}$) is characterized by the vanishing of morphisms from $C_{w\ge 1}$ (resp. $C_{w\le -1}$). Some of these results generalize properties of semi-orthogonal decompositions proved in the previous paper, and can be applied to various derived categories of (quasi)coherent sheaves on a scheme $X$ that is projective over an affine noetherian one. We also study hearts of orthogonal $t$-structures and their restrictions, and prove some statements on "reconstructing" weight structures from orthogonal $t$-structures.
item.dc:creator: Mikhail V. Bondarko

item.title: A cellular absolute motivic ring spectrum representing Hermitian K-theory
item.description: arXiv:2411.14857v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In the Morel-Voevodsky motivic stable homotopy category of a quasi-compact quasi-separated scheme S, several candidates exist for a motivic spectrum representing hermitian K-theory. This note shows that the cellular absolute motivic spectrum constructed in the thesis of the first author via the geometry of orthogonal and hyperbolic Grassmannians over any scheme coincides with the motivic ring spectrum constructed recently by Calm\`es, Harpaz, and Nardin.
item.dc:creator: K. Arun Kumar, Oliver R\"ondigs
